column4: I'd have thought that Linux would have been fairly popular in India
why would you think so ?
I mean that's a bit of a generalisation, but essentially you've got pretty fertile ground for developers and users
all MCSE
really?  that's a shame
Minesweeper Consultant and Solitaire Expert
u were at ibm ?
yeah, until about a year ago
how is the b'lore lab ?
I don't know, I never went over there
the guys that work there seem OK though
the quality of work i mean
ah, yeah not bad
depends on what they're doing - we had a large contact centre there doing first line support for a few retail customers (ie shops that use IBM EPOS kit)
the actual tech support was pretty good, but their call entry was rubbish
like, they were supposed to talk the customer through something like (say) a receipt printer with faint print
ok
so they'd get the customer to check all the things they were supposed to, and then if that didn't work they'd tell them they'd pass it on to have an engineer out in an hour with a new printer
which is basically *not* going to happen, and wasn't what they were told to do...

problem with that then is that 2nd level phone the customer up and get an earful because they've been waiting 45 minutes and still no new printer - and then they're not happy when you explain that they're not getting a new printer and in any case it's going to be within *eight* hours that an engineer comes
not the fault of the guys in Bangalore mind you - it's all down to training (or the lack of)
also IBM's internal IT helldesk is in Bangalore, so what does that tell you?
